name: SpringHill Suites Seattle Downtown/South Lake Union

reviews.text: We stay in Seattle a lot and each time we have picked a different place as we never seem to find what we exactly need. Since our kids are grown up, we need a larger room with some privacy. We finally have found our place to stay in Seattle. The rooms are large with enough room and beds to make everyone happy.
reviews.title: Great place on the 4th of July

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We walked down to the wharf to watch the fireworks which is only a 30 minute walk. We enjoyed "windo shopping" at the wharf for the $3M boats and enjoyed great chowder before the fireworks.
reviews.title: Great stay at Springhill Suites

likes.disliked: — The pool area - not very inviting.

reviews.text: The Springhill is a bit hard to get to off of the freeway but extremely easy to get on to the freeway.
reviews.title: Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only issue is that the beds are extremely hard. We laid down a blanket to sleep on the bed to make it a little more comfy. Very nice breakfast buffet but real difficult to find a place to sit. Get there early. The $18 parking fee is a little steep but there is a cheaper parking lot next door if you don't want the valet to handle things. The valet help is awesome as is the front desk. This will be our home in Seattle from now on. Nothing else matches up for the price.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here June 28 for 2 nights prior to our Alaskan cruise and one night after the cruise. Room was booked by our tour company and what a pleasant surprise! The staff was great - very accommodating. Our room was a nice size with a mini kitchen. Bathroom was spotless and had a brand new shower head that was just wonderful after a long day of sightseeing. The pool was rather small and in the afternoon seemed to be rather crowded. The fitness room was small also, but all guests of the hotel were welcome to use the 24-hour fitness center just across the street - just show them your room key. Also across the street is a Starbucks, of course! The location was great for us - we don't mind walking. The hotel offers a free shuttle service to the Space Needle, but you have to make reservations for it - we didn't want to be bothered since everything was within walking distance. Pike Place Market and the waterfront were just about a 15-minute walk and a great shopping district just a 10-minute walk. In the Westlake Mall, within the shopping district, you can catch the monorail ($2 each way) to the Space Needle. There was a Whole Foods market also within walking distance that offers a great salad bar and hot food bar if you don't feel like eating out at a restaurant. You could eat in the market or take it back to the hotel. I highly recommend Springhill Suites for a pleasant stay in Seattle.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.disliked: — Nothing, free parking would have been cool, but considering location...

reviews.text: We stayed at the Marriott Springhill Suites from November 21-24. We drove from California-terrible traffic from Salem to Vancouver WA. Arrived at 9:30pm. We were immediately helped from our car, however, there was no one to bring up our luggage so my husband brought a luggage cart to the car to unload. Since we had been driving for a long time, we sort of had things all over the car. The vallet was sort of in a hurry to park our car and we were unable to remove everything. By the time we got to our room we realized we were missing several items. We had to wait for the vallet to come back and then ask for the keys and directions to our car. We then had to hand carry many items to the room. The room was nice. However, the sofa bed looked a bit old and tired. Unfortunantly, the beds were only doubles. It was my husband and I and our daughter. All rooms have only double beds unless you order a king room. Most hotel rooms I have stayed in offer two queen beds. Room was very stuffy and there was no way to create a more unstuffy environment, we even turned on the A/C and ran the fan. The toilet was not in very good working order and we had to call housekeeping on several occasions. On Thanksgiving day there was no room service until 5:00pm. We were visiting with family so we wanted some appetizers in the room. We had to go down to the bar and pick these up. Also, not much space in the room to eat. The breakfast is fair, but very boring with styrofoam plates and plastic silverware. My grandson did enjoy the indoor pool and sauna. That was very nice. Parking $18.00 - when our son and his family came to visit, his parking fee was $10.00. Overall check in and out was very easy, our room was clean, beds comfortable but too small and staff was friendly and helpful. I think on my next trip to Seattle I will look a smaller hotel less commerical hotel.
reviews.title: Average stay at the Springhill Suites

likes.disliked: — Small double beds, small bathroom and vanity area, no table, toilet not working well

reviews.text: First of all, if you are sleeping in Seattle, check out Seattlesupersaver.com. It often offers the cheapest rates. It is part of the Seattle Chamber of Commerce. You don't have to pay up front and you can cancel your reservation without penalty.
reviews.title: North of Downtown but hourly shuttle- teenage son Loved it

likes.liked: — Hot breakfast and great value. Beautiful room

reviews.text: I stayed here in a studio suite with a teenage son. He liked having a pool to "check out the chicks." He didn't care that he was in a suite with Mom. He just crashed on the sofa bed.
reviews.title: Spring hill suprise

likes.disliked: — checking in to a dirty room

reviews.text: This hotel remains a great value. We had a refrigerator, microwave and kitchen sink area which my teenage boy needed.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.text: There is also a hot breakfast included. You can't beat the value.
reviews.title: Good Deal

likes.liked: — The friendly staff and good service

reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 week and enjoyed it. My wife had a conference at the convention center Sun-Wed and I worked from the hotel room. The chair, desk, and free wired internet were fine and I had no problems. The mini-fridge was nice to have too. We didn't use the 24 hour fitness directly across the street but it was free with room card. We did use the hotel pool/hot tub and it was nice. It was only 10-15 minute walk to the convention center if you weren't able to take the hotel shuttle that only left on the hour.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: We did have a room on the 5th floor that faced the highway (I-5 is very close). The traffic was somewhat loud, but I didn't find it very disturbing. I always bring earplugs when staying in hotels and slept fine with them in. If you are sensitive to noise, you should request a room that does not face I-5. The only real complaint I had was it was all one big room. I guess I am used to Embassy Suites where the bedroom is separated by a wall and door. You could not have one person sleep and another watch TV since the TV was between the bed and couch (with 1/2 wall between them).
reviews.title: Great Value
Good rooms but very noisy at night
reviews.text: The breakfast was surprisingly good. You could make your own waffles and they even had fruit and whipped cream toppings along with maple and boysenberry syrup. They had 5+ types of cereal, several types of breads and toasters, bacon, sausage, oatmeal, fruit, and milk/juices/coffee daily. Some days they even had pancakes, but not every day.

reviews.title: quick 2 day getaway
reviews.text: Overall, a nice hotel with free internet and free breakfast downtown. I would definitely stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Springhill Suites was a pleasant surprise. It was very clean, rooms were spacious with a mini fridge and a microwave. A free hot breakfast every morning, and most of all the friendliest staff I have encountered in a long time. They also have an arrangement to use the facilities at the 24 hour gym across the street free of charge. I would suggest not renting a car since driving and parking in Seattle is a total disaster, plus you end up spending a small fortune on parking no matter where you go. They have an hourly free shuttle that goes to the Space Needle and shopping area, and from there you can catch the monorail. I would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Comfortable and not really that far from the city

likes.liked: — Free broadband access, network cable included!
likes.disliked: — Cheap & wasteful plastic plates and cutlery in the breakfast room.

reviews.text: My 16 year old son and I spent 3 nights at Springhill Suites this August and I highly recommend this property.
reviews.title: Great stay and location

reviews.text: The front desk staff were fantastic and always ready to help. For example, we had a plumbing issue (our fault not the hotel's) and within minutes it was dealt with and resolved. While it took two calls, it was also 8am Sunday morning during the rush of check-outs, they they still were pleasant and took care of the problem.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: As for the location - it is a short walk to the convention center and there are countless stores and small malls and eateries within 15 minutes of the door. We never needed a car the entire time. Even on our last day when we missed the final tour bus back from Pikes Place market walk back was maybe 20 minutes (and not at all difficult).
reviews.title: OK Hotel

likes.disliked: — street/highway noise - location away from downtown and bus stops - and parking fee

reviews.text: The morning breakfast was good - eggs, meat, oatmeal, fresh make-it-yourself waffles with strawberries... Even the coffee was surprisingly good at the breakfast bar (of course, it's Seattle - it better, be).
reviews.title: Highly recommend

likes.liked: — Excellent staff, accomodations, breakfast, maid service...

reviews.text: Overall a great stay - for the price, too - and I would go back.
reviews.title: slept in seattle

aka: Springhill Suites Seattle Downtown/South Lake Union Hotel Seattle
description: Welcome to the SpringHill Suites Seattle Downtown hotel. Just minutes from the Westlake Center via light rail, the Convention Center, The Space Needle, Waterfront, Pike Place Market and the Cruise Terminal's, our Seattle hotel's accommodations offer easy access to many of the city's top attractions. Start your day with a free hot breakfast buffet, and end it with a specialty cocktail at our Bistro on Yale Bar (happy hour is from 4-7 p.m.), or enjoy fresh regional fare at the Bistro on Yale Restaurant. Guests can also enjoy our Seattle downtown hotel's swimming pool, spa, fitness center, and free shuttle service. We are also proud to offer Complimentary access to 24 Hour Fitness located across the street. On-site parking is a valet-only service for a fee. All of our Seattle hotel suites offer spacious living and sleeping areas separated by a privacy wall, as well as kitchenettes with mini-refrigerators and microwaves. We look forward to welcoming you to the SpringHill Suites Seattle Downtown hotel.
